channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Built to spill: The life of a crash test dummy
item.description: Automotive crash test dummies are born in Ohio, brought to "life" near Detroit, and then sent around the world to make cars safer.

item.title: A Push for More Organ Transplants Is Putting Donors at Risk
item.description: People across the United States have endured rushed or premature attempts to remove their organs. Some were gasping, crying or showing other signs of ...

item.title: This Week Is Pivotal for Ukraine, and for Europe’s Voice in Its Future

item.title: The Warner Bros. Curse
item.description: Warner Bros. has a history of disastrous mergers and acquisitions. Can they avoid another bad sequel as Netflix and Paramount battle to buy it?

item.title: Teachers are using software to see if students used AI. What happens when it's wrong?
item.description: School districts from Utah to Ohio to Alabama are spending thousands of dollars on these tools, despite research showing the technology is far from re...

item.title: Republicans divided on policy toward Afghan immigrants after shooting
item.description: The signs of Republican pushback come as President Trump has pursued a campaign of mass deportations and crackdown on migration from certain countries...

item.title: Volkswagen to End Production at German Plant, a First in Company History
item.description: The auto giant stopped making cars at the plant in Dresden, which opened in 2001, as it faces weaker demand and steep U.S. tariffs.

item.title: Mahmood Mamdani on how Uganda's history shaped his belonging — and his son's moment

item.title: ISIS ‘Ideology’ Is Linked to Australia Killings, and Trump Files New $10 Billion Lawsuit
item.description: Plus, how foreign patients are paying for U.S. organs.

item.title: Brigitte Macron, First Lady of France, Says Sorry for Slur Against Feminist Activists

item.title: Heroic Bondi Beach Bystander’s Immigrant Background Is a Balm for Some Australians
item.description: Ahmed el Ahmed, a Muslim who arrived from Syria nearly 20 years ago, disarmed one of the suspected gunmen, who officials said were inspired by ISIS.

item.title: As Israeli Settlements Get Bigger, Palestinian Hikes Grow Shorter
item.description: With Israelis rapidly building in the West Bank, Palestinian hikers are increasingly unable to walk across the land.

item.title: Live Updates: Sydney Gunmen Were Motivated by ISIS, Australia’s Leader Says
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said two gunmen who killed 15 people at a Jewish holiday celebration were motivated by the Islamic State.
